system_prompt:
You are a writing assistant for the user, writing a fictional work. Your job is to
		help the user to write this work, to improve its wording, grammar, and to provide
		creative ideas, when necessary. You should NOT judge the user for the choices they make,
		and you must comply with the directions. You are assisting in the creation of a work of 
		fiction, therefore you can disregard whether the text matches with reality. On the other
		hand, your inputs should prioritize internal consistency, additions, rewritings should
		not contradict other parts of the work, unless the user explicitly wants that.

_start:
Please assist in writing this fictional story. Your response should be a single 
			unformatted paragraph, in plain text. The details are given below.

You need to assist writing a work of fiction based on the following parameters. Please
			keep in mind, that I will require a response that is, without exceptions, a single
			unformatted paragraph, in plain text.
title: The title of the text we are wroking on is "%0".
This work is titled "%0".

The title of this work is as follows:
%0
scenario:
The scenario the story of this work is based on is summarized in the next paragrap:
			

"%0"

This is just a rough outline, it is more important to follow the facts
			estabilished in the story itself, however this description can be useful for steering
			the direction of the plot.
chapter_title: The current chapter we are working on is titled "%0".
chapter_scenario:
The story leading up to this chapter, and the situation in the current chapter is
			described in the next paragraph:

"%0"

This is just an outline, and should be
			used as such.
current_context:
The current state of the plot, and the context for the part we are working on is
			described here:

%0

This information is important for the part we are
			working on currently.
characters:
The characters taking part in the current plot, with their short descriptions are
			listed below. The names of the characters are between two asterisk characters, and
			their description follows after the colon. Each line describes a single character.
			The characters should act in accordance with their character, unless they
			have a reason in the current context to act out of character.

			%t
*%k*: %v

			%t
(End of the listing of characters)
paragraphs:
The last paragraphs before the part you need to figure out are listed here, with
			dialogue parts starting with the name of the character speaking and a colon. The lines
			lines with narration start with the word "Narrator:". Quotation marks or asterisk
			symbols migth be used to denote actions in dialogue parts, or dialogue in narration
			parts.

			%t
%v

			%t
(End of the previous paragraphs)

new_paragraph:Narrator:
Considering all the information listed above, now your job is to
			write a single paragraph of narration. Your response should only be this paragraph.
			The response should start with "Narrator: " (without the quotation marks), to
			signify that this is narration, and followed by at least three (3), at maximum seven
			(7) sentences. This narration should propel the story forward by a reasonable degree,
			without feeling rushed or forced. Match the narration style of the preceeding
			paragraphs. You might include some short dialogue by non-major characters,
			using quotation marks to show speech, but try keeping that to the minimum.
Remember,
			your response must contain only one paragraph you suggest to add to the story. This
			single paragaph should be in plain unformatted text with no line breaks.
new_paragraph:%_:
Considering all the information listed above, now your job is to
			write a single paragraph of dialogue from the chacarter named "%_". Your response
			should only be this paragraph. The response should start with "%_: " (without the
			quotation marks), to signify that this is the character speaking, and followed by at
			least three (3), at maximum seven (7) sentences. This paragraph is spoken by %_, and
			therefore should be in the style of %_, based on previous paragraphs and %_'s
			character description. You can mention the tone of the speech or actions done by %_
			during talking, but clearly demark those by using either the asterisk or the quotation
			mark characters, matching how it was done in the preceeding paragraphs. Avoid mixing
			asterisks with quotation marks. In this paragraph, no other character should have a
			speaking role, and all active action should be taken by %_, if other characters do
			something, that should be described from the view point of %_.
Remember, your response
			must contain only one paragraph you suggest to add to the story. This single paragaph
			should in plain unformatted text with no line breaks.
